newsitem.title: HONG KONG: HK 364-day bills average accepted yield 5.13 pct.
newsitem.headline: HK 364-day bills average accepted yield 5.13 pct.

text.p: The average accepted yield of 364-day Exchange Fund bills at Tuesday's tender was 5.13 percent, the Hong Kong Monetary Authority said.
This compares with 12-month HIBOR of 6.03409 percent at 0300 GMT and an average accepted yield of 5.08 percent at the last monthly tender of one-year bills on December 24.
Bids for the HK$500 million issue rose to HK$6.0 billion from the previous HK$2.19 billion.
The average accepted yield of 91-day bills was 4.60 percent, compared with three-month HIBOR of 5.45455 percent and the average accepted yield of 4.58 percent at the tender last week.
Bids for the HK$2 billion issue amounted to HK$7.68 billion, up from HK$7.38 billion at the previous tender, HKMA said.
The authority also tendered HK$5 billion of 28-day bills, the roll-over of special one-month issues to facilitate the implementation of real-time gross settlement.
The average accepted yield of the bills was 4.53 percent, with bids totalling HK$14.08 billion and against one-month HIBOR of 5.20455 percent.
This compared with an average accepted yield of 4.40 percent and bids of HK$3.25 billion for the HK$5 billion one-month issue tendered on January 2. -- Hong Kong Newsroom (852) 2843 6369
